definitions: set of stairs inside a building with supporting structure and handrails
examples: The wooden staircase creaked under their footsteps
She held the staircase railing while descending carefully

definitions: passage consisting of steps going from one level to another
examples: The emergency stairway provided a safe exit route
We climbed the narrow stairway to the attic

definitions: enclosed space in a building containing the stairs between floors
examples: The stairwell echoed with footsteps from above
Emergency lights illuminated the dark stairwell during evacuation

definitions: person or group with investment, share, or interest in a business or project
examples: All stakeholders attended the quarterly business meeting
The project manager consulted stakeholders before making changes

definitions: situation where no progress can be made because opposing sides are equally balanced
examples: Negotiations reached a stalemate after hours of discussion
The chess match ended in a stalemate position

definitions: main stem of a plant that supports leaves or flowers
persistent following or harassment of someone
examples: The flower's stalk bent under the weight of rain
She cut the celery stalks into small pieces
The detective noticed signs of stalk behavior in the case
His repeated stalk attempts made her feel unsafe

definitions: person who persistently follows or harasses another person obsessively
examples: The celebrity hired security to protect against stalkers
Police arrested the stalker outside her workplace yesterday

definitions: criminal activity of following and watching someone persistently and obsessively
examples: She filed charges for stalking against her ex-boyfriend
Online stalking has become increasingly common in recent years

definitions: small enclosed area for an animal or market vendor
sudden loss of power in an engine or aircraft
deliberate delay or evasion to avoid action
examples: The horse waited patiently in its stall
She set up her jewelry stall at the market
The car engine stall happened at the intersection
The pilot recovered quickly from the unexpected stall
His stall tactics frustrated the negotiating team members
She used a stall to buy more preparation time

definitions: action of deliberately delaying or avoiding something to gain time
examples: His constant stalling annoyed the project manager greatly
The committee recognized her stalling for what it was

definitions: adult male horse that has not been castrated
examples: The black stallion galloped across the open field
Breeding stallions require experienced handlers for safety reasons

definitions: person who is loyal, reliable, and hardworking in supporting a cause or organization
examples: Party stalwarts gathered for the annual fundraising dinner
She remained a stalwart defender of civil rights

definitions: ability to sustain prolonged physical or mental effort without fatigue
examples: Marathon runners need exceptional stamina to finish races
Building stamina requires consistent training over many months

definitions: sudden rush of frightened animals or people moving together
examples: The loud noise caused a stampede among the cattle
A stampede occurred when doors opened for the sale

definitions: tool or machine that presses marks or designs onto surfaces
examples: The postal stamper marked each envelope with today's date
She used a rubber stamper for addressing envelopes quickly

definitions: process of making things conform to a standard or consistent format
examples: Product standardisation helps reduce manufacturing costs across factories
The standardisation of measurements improved international trade significantly

definitions: process of making things conform to a standard or consistent format
examples: Industry standardization ensures compatible parts between different manufacturers
The standardization of safety protocols prevented many workplace accidents

definitions: state of readiness to act or be used when needed
examples: Emergency generators remained on standby during the storm
The medical team stayed on standby for urgent cases

definitions: person who is standing or one who takes a position
examples: Early standers at the concert got the best views
The lone stander refused to sit during the protest

definitions: situation where neither side in a conflict will give way
examples: The police standoff lasted for several tense hours
A diplomatic standoff developed between the two nations

definitions: particular way of thinking about or judging a situation
examples: From a financial standpoint, the merger made perfect sense
Her standpoint on education differed from traditional views

definitions: situation where all movement or activity has stopped completely
examples: Traffic came to a standstill during rush hour
Negotiations reached a standstill over salary disagreements yesterday

definitions: grouped set of lines within a poem, usually with consistent pattern
examples: Each stanza contained four lines of rhythmic verse
The poet separated themes using a new stanza

definitions: bent metal wire used to fasten papers together
basic food or product that is used regularly
examples: She used a staple to attach the pages together
The staple bent when hitting the thick document
Rice is a staple food in many Asian countries
Coffee became a staple of their morning routine

definitions: right side of a ship or aircraft when facing forward
examples: The captain ordered a turn to starboard immediately
Passengers gathered on the starboard deck for photos

definitions: white carbohydrate food substance found in potatoes, rice, and used for stiffening fabric
examples: Potato starch thickened the soup to perfect consistency
She added starch to make the shirt collar crisp

definitions: state of being famous as an entertainer or sports personality
examples: Her rise to stardom happened almost overnight unexpectedly
Many actors dream of stardom but few achieve it

definitions: tiny particles of matter in space or magical quality of glamour
examples: Scientists study stardust to understand cosmic origins better
The movie captured the stardust of Hollywood's golden age

definitions: fictional spacecraft designed for combat in science fiction stories
examples: The pilot maneuvered her starfighter through the asteroid field
Enemy starfighters approached from behind the planet's moon

definitions: star-shaped sea creature with five or more arms radiating from center
examples: The orange starfish clung to the underwater rock
Children found a starfish in the shallow tide pool

definitions: person who observes or studies stars, often as a hobby
examples: Amateur stargazers gathered for the meteor shower event
The young stargazer identified three constellations without help

definitions: young actress who is publicized as a future star
examples: The Hollywood starlet attended her first premiere nervously
Many starlets struggle with sudden fame and attention

definitions: natural light that reaches Earth from stars in space
examples: They danced together under the soft starlight glow
The starlight was bright enough to see the path

definitions: small to medium-sized bird with dark, often iridescent plumage
examples: A flock of starlings created patterns in the sky
The starling built its nest under the roof tiles

definitions: large spacecraft designed for interstellar travel in science fiction
examples: The starship crew prepared for the long journey ahead
Their starship could travel faster than light speed theoretically

definitions: sudden shock or alarm causing a person or animal to jump
examples: The loud noise gave everyone a terrible startle
Her startle response made her drop the coffee cup

definitions: newly established business company, typically in technology, seeking rapid growth
examples: The tech startup received funding from several investors
Many startups fail within their first two years

definitions: suffering or death caused by extreme and prolonged lack of food
examples: International aid prevented starvation in the drought-affected region
The rescued animals showed clear signs of starvation

definitions: condition of suffering from extreme hunger or lack of food
examples: The starving refugees desperately needed food and water
After starving for days, they finally found edible berries

definitions: secret store of something, typically money or valuables hidden away
examples: Police discovered a stash of money behind the wall
She kept a stash of chocolate in her desk drawer

definitions: skillful management of state affairs and the art of government and diplomacy
examples: The president demonstrated masterful statecraft during the crisis
Effective statecraft requires balancing domestic and international interests carefully

definitions: experienced and respected political leader who shows wisdom in government affairs
examples: The elder statesman advised younger politicians on diplomacy
History remembers him as a great statesman and peacemaker

definitions: crackling noise on radio or television caused by electrical disturbance
showing little or no change, action, or progress
examples: Radio static made the broadcast difficult to understand
The old television showed nothing but static patterns
Sales remained static throughout the entire third quarter
Their relationship became static after years of marriage

definitions: person who sells stationery and office supplies in a shop
examples: The local stationer ordered special pens for the customer
Our stationer stocks all types of writing paper varieties
